phrases: /** TS by scol **/
/** name move **/
Sorry... I...
thought uncle committed suicide.
He was not such a coward.
He was a man that the more difficult things got, the more he would bare with it and work hard.
And he never once complained about it.
Yeah, you are right.
He even gave up sleep,
and just focused on drawing something.
Moritaka, have you read Kyojin no Hoshi?
Eh, yes.
Then you know Sakamoto Ryouma's line, right?
Yes.
You really liked Ashita no Joe, right?
Yes.
Dad, you do not need to say any more.
Thank you.
Yeah.
Azuki?
It is her mom!
This is Azuki's mom!
Become great mangakas.
I will be here, rooting for you.
Okay, thank you very much!
Okay!
I sure am blessed.
Not I, we!
No matter what, I will make this dream a reality!
If I cannot do this...
I am not a man!
I will not be!
Starting tomorrow,
No, today, I am going to start making my drawings into manga artwork!
All right, and I will take on making a name!
Translator TLc
kewl0210 watchrocksgrow Chrno
Timing Edit
GeRi, Leet_Garaa bobo343, Z4kku
Typesetting Karaoke
scol, KmE Jecht, KmE, pablo212
QC
Mistral Echo_Chidori
Encode
pablo212
Time and Key
Most pros use G-pens.
They let you control the strength of the lines...
and brings out more atmosphere in the drawings.
But I could not master them, so I use a kabura pen.
TL note: The kabura in the pen name means turnip, coming from the shape.
I do gag manga so I can barely get away with it, but pros use G-pens.
Once in a while I try to use them, but they are really hard.
Mashiro.
Mashiro, wake up!
Eh?
Crap!
Mashiro, it is fine to work hard all night,
but if you fall asleep during the test then there is no point to it, is there?
S-Sorry.
Finally done...
Are you all right?
I have never seen someone fall asleep during a midterm.
Saikou!
Did you study so hard it caused ya to doze off?
Not really.
Anyhow, the test's over, so you want to catch a movie?
Yeah, yeah!
That sexy one!
Sexy one?!
Sorry, I have got stuff to do.
What?
He is been spending all his time with whatever that is.
So were you up all night practicing drawing?
I was at the workplace since midnight.
All the way until I got called by my parents to come home.
In school, when I could not calm down, taking the test with this pen gave me momentum.
Woah, you really did bring it...
Anyhow, if I cannot get used to this, the whole thing's not going to happen.
Manga does not have limits.
Limits?
It is not like a test which has answers.
There is no upper limit to drawings or stories.
The better you can make them, the better off you are.
I am going to the workplace, you coming too?
Sure!
You seem happy, Shuujin.
Here, your duplicate key, Shuujin.
C-Can I really have it?
It is more convenient for you to be able to go whenever you want, right?
T-Thanks.
The test's over, so I can fully devote myself to this now.
Awesome!
I knew your talent for drawing was not half bad!
After just one day you are able to do manga quality drawings!
I am saying those are totally no good.
What about them?
The lines are stiff and they are way too thick.
Those are not drawings that can be used for manga.
Really?
I knew G-pens would be tough...
I cannot draw the thickness of what I am imagining in my head.
It was giving me trouble, so I tried using a kabura pen, too.
Kabura pen?
This.
Yeah.
When I hear of dip pens, I think of these.
Uncle used these when he could not figure out how to use G-pens either.
He was told to use G-pens by his editor,
but because of its odd tendencies he could not master it,
so he just used the kabura pens.
It is hard to get different line strengths, but its easier to draw lines at a fixed thickness.
G-pens let you control the strength of the lines, but...
it is easy for them to get caught on the paper.
I see.
So even though your uncle became a pro using a kabura pen,
that is no good for us, huh?
Of course!
It cannot give the drawings flavor or atmosphere.
Uncle shrugged it off, saying my drawings are crappy.
And since he was doing gag manga, he said he could get away with it.
That is true...
Anyhow, it is totally different from doing rough sketches with a pencil or doing watercolor painting with a brush.
I have got no choice but to keep drawing until I get used to it.
I drew these yesterday, too.
These are good!
But I better not say so.
Saikou's still not satisfied with them
Kabura pens are good for drawing backgrounds.
And round pens are good for extra-thin lines.
So you drew by looking at those?
Yeah.
I got them all out of the boxes and lined them up.
So they sell this kind of sample material?
With these you will be able to draw manuscripts perfectly, will not you?
I need to put effects in, too.
Effects?
These.
Uncle directed his assistants on which to use with numbers,
but first I have to be able to do them myself.
All these kinds of lines can be drawn by hand?
While using these sorts of rulers.
We do not have any assistants,
so I even have to put in the screen tones myself.
I used a cutter to cut these out and put them in.
So in short, in order to make one page of a manuscript...
First you start with a name and make it an under-sketch on a paper used for manuscripts...
Then you ink the characters and backgrounds.
Yeah.
And then you ink in the effects and affix the screen tones...
And then it is finally finished, huh?
There sure is a lot to do.
Yeah.
The exact operation may vary depending on the person, but
I think it is got this feeling in general.
When I realized how much I have to master before I can draw something we can bring in, I got impatient.
Still humans are easy,
but movement, facial expressions, composition...
Unless I can draw them all, I will never be a pro.
I do not know how long it is going to take...
Thinking about it now, it is amazing that Uncle only took three years to go from a total beginner to his debut.
And he did not even know about the existence of white-out,
so if he made even a little mistake, he would have to redo that whole page.
H-Heh, is that right...?
But we have got to do it!
An anime adaptation by 18...
I really cannot waste even a single second!
Saikou,
I understand how you feel but I think you should at least study on days before tests.
Yeah, I know.
I planned to study a little yesterday, but it was morning before I knew it.
Before you knew it...?
Anyhow, right now I just need to put in effort.
Uncle used to say that too.
It was one of his requirements for becoming a mangaka.
Requirements for becoming a mangaka?
For the Kawaguchi Tarou type.
Three major requirements for if you are not a genius.
T-Tell me, too!
First: hubris.
First
HUBRIS
Think you are better than everyone else.
I have got that.
But then it is not so much hubris, I have actual talent...
That is what hubris is.
Second: effort.
Second
EFFORT
So he can be straightforward, too, that Kawaguchi Tarou-sensei.
Yup?
Third
LUCK
Right, luck.
Eh?
What?
So in the end it is all about luck...?
Of course.
If you are not a genius, you are just a gambler after all.
But just talking about dreams will not make them a reality.
I am going to keep drawing all weekend.
Okay!
Then I am going to read all the manga in this place!
This Chichi no Tamashii is so sad...
TL note: Chichi no Tamashii = Father's Soul
Along the way,
people stood in line, and until they could see their shadows behind them,
hey send them off as much as they could.
Okay, that is enough.
Ok, next is...
Suzuki.
O-Okay!
Please stop with the okays.
Wh-Why?
I do not really have a reason behind it.
That is mean!
Okay, Kawasaki!
So we are going to head straight to the workplace?
Yeah.
I am going to buy Jack.
Go ahead.
Let us see, this week's opening color is...
Hm, I also need...
Saikou!
H-Hey, come here a sec.
This!
Niizuma Eiji (15)
Aomori
Tezuka Award
Semi-Finalist Winner
SEMI-FINALIST PRIZE WINNER!!
Prize
1 Million Yen
It is the semi-finalist prize winner for the Tezuka award.
Th-This semi-finalist...
What?
The age, look at it!
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori

Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori

Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori

Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori

Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Niizuma Eiji (15) Aomori
Fifteen years old?
Fifteen years old?
It says here he is a high school student.
Received high praise from all the judges.
Niizuma Eiji.
This is kind of annoying.
His acceptance speech.
Even when everyone was playing video games and hanging out,
I found it worthwhile to work hard.
I am looking forward to continuing that work and contributing energetically to the pages of Jack Magazine.
It is like he is taking a jab at me, since all I did was play video games up until now.
It will take us no time at all to surpass this guy.
If you look closely, you will see that the only thing he is being praised for is his art.
That is some confidence.
Confidence, effort and luck are all that count.
More like hubris, effort and luck.
I think confidence sounds better.
Anyway, check out the new Kochikame.
15 years old and he is a semi-finalist.
Moritaka.
I understand you are happy about getting that key,
but do you have to spend every day hanging around your uncle's studio?
You have exams to worry about.
I know that.
Do you really?
If you do, then start studying.
Can I get seconds please?
Sure.
Thank you, Kayoko-san.
I am heading up to the roof.
Wait up, I am coming too.
Awesome, it is totally moe.
It is like, you are going to be a pro mangaka in no time.
Well you know, if I really get serious I might just change the industry.
Yeah!
I will come up with the story this time, so you can just focus on the art.
Well, I do not mind, but I have high standards.
Hey, can I ask you a question?
What?
Why are they all looking in the same direction?
And you have only drawn them to the shoulders.
Those guys were laughing at us!
That was Takagi from Class 2.
Who was the other guy?
Not sure, what was his name?
Who was that?
Miyoshi Kaya.
Azuki's best friend.
I know that.
I was talking about the guy doing the drawing.
Ishizawa, he was in my class during second year.
Is he also trying to become a mangaka?
Who knows?
I think he is just telling people he is drawing manga in order to attract attention.
Miyoshi was making fun of him, so I do not think he will get too far.
Do not start slacking off just because midterms are over.
Your real test is going to be the high school entrance examination.
Please use these midterms as a base to think seriously about your future.
Yes sir.
Alright, then I will begin the class.
Alright!
I was able to polish up the story.
Let us get to the studio and work our asses off writing names!
Saikou?
Hey.
I guess there are a lot of guys like us trying to become mangaka.
SUMMER TRAINING COURSE
This Summer is Your Chance!!
Get Ahead by Improving hhYour Basic Skills!!
- North Shirokita Prep
Maybe.
That guy, Niizuma Eiji, was only 15, and there is Ishizawa..
I do not really know where he is going.
I do not mind going to North Yakusa High.
North Yakusa?
It might be easy for a top-scorer like you, Shuujin,
but this is the lowest level my dad will accept.
I want to set aside some time to just draw manga.
All in order to become a mangaka, huh?
I have never thought of my time as being so precious before.
I have never gotten this much into anything before.
But Saikou, are you sure you are okay going to a different high school from Azuki?
I do not know where she is going.
She might even wind up at an all-girls school.
Ask her then.
No, I will go to a different school.
That would be more... romantic!
There it is!
The DNA of a romanticist!
GRADUATION
The next time we meet after graduating from middle school,
GRADUATION
will be when I am a mangaka, and Azuki is a seiyuu!
Do your best
Until then, we will just encourage one another through mail.
That is right...
Yeah.
Hey, you do not have to try so hard to imitate your uncle.
I want to.
I am sure it is what Azuki wants too.
Saikou, are you even thinking about the possibility that Azuki might get a boyfriend in high school?
I am not.
I trust her.
You are going to North High, even if it means being apart from Azuki?
In order to have more time to write manga?
Yeah.
Then I will go to North High too.
Huh?!
You should go to prep school!
If we are seriously trying to become mangaka,
it would be more convenient and time efficient for us to be in the same school.
I feel the same way you do.
Besides, I was really happy to get this.
I was going to try to get into a good university,
in case this mangaka thing did not work out.
But it would not be right to assign priority to a contingency plan.
Shuujin?
So North High, it is decided.
Do not flunk the test, Saikou.
Yeah, no problem, then we can focus on manga.
We cannot keep letting our peers beat us.
You are right.
So our current rival is Niizuma Eiji.
I heard something about Eiji getting assigned an editor...
and being serialized at the time of his graduation.
He already has an editor?
He definitely got one.
He got one automatically when he won the prize.
Even if he had not won, he could have just found an editor he was on good terms with.
That is what my uncle was saying.
An editor, huh?
It seems Eiji is getting ahead of us by leaps and bounds.
And there are good and bad editors too,
so it does not seem like it will be as simple as just getting one.
It is not in our power to choose though,
so whether or not we can find a good one...
Luck, huh?
There are editors who do nothing but spew misguided criticism,
or who just slack off after picking up the manuscript.
That sucks.
Let me tell you a story I found a bit moving, about an editor.
He told a newcomer that had some work published in another magazine your work has promise,
so write as much as you can and bring it here, and kept putting pressure on him to write more.
But when he finished reading through the tenth manuscript the newcomer brought him...
He fed it through a shredder?!
Why do you find that moving?
That newcomer was always getting rejected after only having the first few pages of his manuscript read.
So, he was happy that the editor had read his work to the end,
and he used the frustration of seeing his work shredded as a spring, and proceeded to become a popular artist.
I guess it becomes a good story from there.
Then, at the meeting to discuss his serialization,
I am sorry about that,
but I thought that you would grow more if I did not praise you.
Thank you so much.
Sounds like bullshit.
That editor went on to become editor-in-chief.
That sounds like a manga plot.
My uncle said most editors out there are just as passionate about manga as that.
That they all love manga.
Hey.
Yeah?
Want To go meet an editor?
If we call'them up and tell him we want to show him a manuscript, we could meet one.
Meet, but-
We do not have a manuscript to bring yet.
Let us finish one up by the end of summer.
Then we will bring it to Jack.
If we are looking to get it serialized and turned into an anime,
Jack is our best bet, right?
If we get rejected then we will be no worse off.
We will see how they react after seeing our manuscript.
Let us see how far our current skills can go.
Alright, let us do it!
We will complete our work during summer break,
and bring it to Jack!
If that is decided, then let us get to the studio!
Right!
Hey, look.
Azuki?
I heard she had a little sister in 5th grade,
but her sister's cute too!
This is bad, what should I do?
What is bad about it?
This is your chance to ask her for her email.
She is with that powerful mother of hers.
Would you ask her if it was one on one?
Shut up.
We will just pass by and pretend we did not notice them, okay?
You would notice her.
Just do it.
Looks like Azuki noticed us too.
She is clearly blushing, and she is moved behind her mother.
I do not need you to report.
Hey Miho, are not those your friends from class?
Hey Sis, you are blushing!
Mina!
Wow, you and Azuki are shy.
I am surprised you can feign indifference when you are in the same classroom.
I said shut up!
Niizuma
The editor-in-chief is also showering you with praises for your work.
Niizuma
Of course I also think you have great talent.
So, we were wondering if you would be willing to come to Tokyo?
Niizuma-kun?
Preview of Next Episode
Does not Takagi-san like you, Miho?
Huh?
I mean, was not he asking you about your dreams before?
That is...
What, what?
Maybe I will tell you later.
Maybe?!
Summer hand Name
Next time, Summer and Name
A busy dream-filled summer!
